content.description: The small and steep overhang with sandstone features spotlights this boulder problem. Sit start with hands matched on the juggy pinch. Work your way up the good side pulls to a shelf before making a big move to the lip. The high feet and mantle onto smooth features arguably makes it the crux of the problem.
content.location: This problem can be found right before entering the narrow corridor and cave-like room of Friends and a Sunset.

content.description: A hidden gem. Starts at a big undercling flake and good feet. Make your way up the good side pulls to good crimp rails before topping out.
content.location:
At the top of the overlook, look for a soft but sketchy downhill to the next level of the overlook. You'll see a gap between the rocks on your left. At the bottom of the hill, turn left and walk into the gap which will open up to a small room. The obvious boulder problem is to your right.

 GPS: 36.156309, -115.436872

content.description:
This area is caught right in the middle of trad and sport walls, namely Meetup Wall, Pet Rock, Hunter S. Thompson Dome, and Sweet Pain Wall. This area was discovered by a group of friends leaving the Meetup Wall area around sunset, when a precipice overlooking the wash, parking lot, and the entire Red Rocks valley against the orange skies became too attractive to ignore. Further exploring this area uncovered some small caves with obvious lines that established the area it is today.

 BE CAREFUL! There are some very narrow paths, small jumps across gaps, and sheer falls in this area. Exercise caution as you hike and climb.
